articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Lebanon's Hezbollah said on Wednesday it fired a rocket targeting Mossad spy agency headquarters near Tel Aviv, which it blamed for the assassination of its leaders and the blowing up communications devices used by its members, in a new escalation that moved the arch-foes closer to full-fledged war.
articles.title: Lebanon's Hezbollah says it launched rocket targeting Mossad base near Tel Aviv

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Russia unleashed an overnight drone strike on the Ukrainian capital Kyiv on Thursday, causing damage to civilian infrastructure, city officials said.
articles.title: Russia launches overnight drone strike on Kyiv

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Russia has established a weapons programme in China to develop and produce long-range attack drones for use in the war against Ukraine, according to two sources from a European intelligence agency and documents reviewed by Reuters.
articles.title: Exclusive: Russia has secret war drones project in China, intel sources say

articles.author: Hyunsu Yim
articles.description: North Korea has enough plutonium and uranium to produce at least a double-digit number of nuclear weapons, a South Korean lawmaker said on Thursday, citing the country's spy agency.
articles.title: North Korea may be able to produce a double-digit number of nuclear weapons, MP says

articles.author: Rich McKay, Brendan O'Brien, Andrew Hay
articles.description: Florida braced for the arrival of Hurricane Helene on Thursday, forecast to be a powerful Category 4 storm when it smashes into the state's panhandle.
articles.title: Hurricane Helene barrels toward Florida with fierce winds, storm surge

articles.author: Mike Stone, Patricia Zengerle, Phil Stewart
articles.description: The United States plans to announce more than $8 billion worth of military assistance for Ukraine on Thursday during Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskiy's visit to Washington, two U.S. officials said on Wednesday.
articles.title: US prepares $8 billion in arms aid packages for Zelenskiy visit, sources say

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Taiwan prosecutors said on Thursday that they have so far questioned four people as witnesses in their investigation into a Taiwanese company linked to pagers that detonated last week in Lebanon in a deadly blow to Hezbollah.
articles.title: Taiwan prosecutors say four questioned so far over exploding pagers

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Australia has urged an estimated 15,000 of its citizens living in Lebanon to leave, flagging a risk Beirut airport may close and the difficulty of evacuating large numbers if the situation worsens.
articles.title: Australia tells thousands of its citizens to leave Lebanon

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Torrential rain lashed India's financial capital Mumbai, triggering floods and killing at least four people as well as paralysing the city and forcing schools to close on Thursday.
articles.title: Heavy rains paralyse Mumbai, at least four dead

articles.author: Kanishka Singh
articles.description: Pulitzer Prize winning author Jhumpa Lahiri declined to accept an award from New York City's Noguchi Museum after it fired three employees for wearing keffiyeh head scarves, an emblem of Palestinian solidarity, following an updated dress code.
articles.title: Pulitzer winner Jhumpa Lahiri declines award over New York museum's keffiyeh ban
